intro: Descurainia cumingiana var. elegantula, commonly known as the elegant silvery mustard, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard species. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, giving the plant a silvery appearance. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
